prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with an event chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What were Stefan's true thoughts and feelings when I stepped off the S-bahn and met him the first time?

Please note that this reading requires 100% accuracy and honesty in interpretation, regardless of whether the aspects reveal positive or negative energies. The chart must be read exactly as it presents itself, without bias in either direction. If the aspects show negativity, that negativity will be revealed fully. If the aspects show positivity, that positivity will be revealed fully. There shall be no softening of negative aspects, nor any dampening of positive ones. The only acceptable outcome is to interpret precisely what the chart demonstrates through its aspects, houses, and planetary positions - be that wonderful, terrible, or anywhere in between. Complete accuracy to the chart's true message is the sole priority.

Also, please do not immediately assume that I'm looking for romantic inclinations. I am not certain what, if any, feelings exist, and what those feelings are deemed to be. That is the reason I have drawn up the chart, is to get a true determination. So, any biasing towards romantic inclination or otherwise should be removed, and ensure that this chart is interpreted fully and objectively to discern the true nature of the questied's feelings, thoughts, and intentions.

Since this chart is drawn up for a specific past event, Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant in this chart.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the chart using event chart principles (I believe they are similar to horary principles). Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a compiled list of the event chart data extracted using horary/event chart principles. (Stefan is represented by the Ascendant.)

1. Planetary Positions (with degrees, signs, and indicated statuses):
 • Sun: 28°49′ Virgo
 • Moon: 13°58′ Taurus
 • Mercury: 20°43′ Virgo
 • Venus: 27°49′ Libra
 • Mars: 9°36′ Cancer
 • Jupiter: 20°48′ Gemini
 • Saturn: 15°2′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Uranus: 27°5′ Taurus (retrograde)
 • Neptune: 28°30′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Pluto: 29°44′ Capricorn (retrograde)
 • North Node: 6°52′ Aries (retrograde)
 • Chiron: 22°14′ Aries (retrograde)
 • Ascendant (Stefan): 28°11′ Libra
 • MC: 6°7′ Leo
 • IC: 6°7′ Aquarius

2. Major Aspects (with orb details):
 • North Node sextile IC – orb: 0°
 • Mercury square Jupiter – orb: 0°
 • MC opposition IC – orb: 0°
 • Sun opposition Neptune – orb: 0°
 • North Node trine MC – orb: 0°
 • Neptune sextile Pluto – orb: 1°
 • Uranus sextile Neptune – orb: 1°
 • Pluto square Ascendant – orb: 1°
 • Venus conjunction Ascendant – orb: 1°
 • Sun trine Pluto – orb: 1°
 • Sun trine Uranus – orb: 1°
 • Jupiter sextile Chiron – orb: 2°
 • Moon sextile Saturn – orb: 2°
 • Venus square Pluto – orb: 2°
 • Uranus trine Pluto – orb: 2°
 • Mars square North Node – orb: 3°
 • Moon sextile Mars – orb: 4°
 • Jupiter square Saturn – orb: 5°
 • Venus opposition Chiron – orb: 5°
 • Mercury opposition Saturn – orb: 5°
 • Chiron opposition Ascendant – orb: 6°
 • Mars trine Saturn – orb: 6°
 • Pluto square Chiron – orb: 7°
 • Moon square IC – orb: 7°
 • Moon square MC – orb: 7°
 • Pluto opposition MC – orb: 7°
 • Pluto conjunction IC – orb: 7°
 • Venus trine Jupiter – orb: 7°
 • Mercury trine Uranus – orb: 7°
 • Moon trine Mercury – orb: 7°
 • Mercury opposition Neptune – orb: 8°
 • Neptune trine MC – orb: 8°
 • Jupiter trine Ascendant – orb: 8°
 • Sun trine IC – orb: 8°

3. Configurations / Patterns:
 • Grand Trine: Sun (28° Virgo), Pluto (29° Capricorn), Uranus (27° Taurus)
 • Kite: Sun (28° Virgo), Pluto (29° Capricorn), Uranus (27° Taurus), Neptune (28° Pisces)
 • T-Square Pattern #1: MC (6° Leo), Moon (13° Taurus), IC (6° Aquarius)
 • T-Square Pattern #2: Ascendant (28° Libra), Pluto (29° Capricorn), Chiron (22° Aries), with Venus (27° Libra) influencing the configuration
 • T-Square Pattern #3: Mercury (20° Virgo), Jupiter (20° Gemini), Saturn (15° Pisces)
 • Yod: Venus (27° Libra), Neptune (28° Pisces), Uranus (27° Taurus) with the Ascendant (28° Libra) as point of resolution

4. Special Features and Qualitative Chart Notes:
 • Moon phase: Waning gibbous
 • Several outer and other key planets are retrograde: Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto, North Node, Chiron
 • Bottom left quadrant of the chart is empty
 • Majority of the inner planets lie on the right side (right of the MC–IC axis)
 • Venus is “rising” (in the 12th House, but with a strong connection to the Ascendant in Libra)
 • Pluto and IC both fall on or near the Nadir
 • The T-Square appears a total of 3 times; the trine aspect is the most frequent with 11 occurrences
 • MC is involved in 10 aspects
 • Venus (in Libra) and Neptune (in Pisces) are in the signs of their rulership

5. House Placements:
 • 1st House (Ascendant, representing Stefan): Starts at 28° Libra
 • 2nd House: Starts at 22° Scorpio
 • 3rd House: Starts at 25° Sagittarius (contains Pluto)
 • 4th House: Starts at 6° Aquarius
 • 5th House: Starts at 11° Pisces (contains Saturn and Neptune)
 • 6th House: Starts at 6° Aries (contains North Node and Chiron)
 • 7th House: Starts at 28° Aries (contains the Moon)
 • 8th House: Starts at 22° Taurus (contains Jupiter and Uranus)
 • 9th House: Starts at 25° Gemini (contains Mars)
 • 10th House: Starts at 6° Leo
 • 11th House: Starts at 11° Virgo (contains Sun and Mercury)
 • 12th House: Starts at 6° Libra (contains Venus)

Relevant Observational Points for Stefan (Ascendant):
 • Ascendant in Libra at 28°11′, directly receiving:
  – A conjunction with Venus (27°49′ Libra), suggesting an immediate, aesthetic or relational quality
  – A square from Pluto (29°44′ Capricorn), indicating an intense, transformative, possibly secretive or conflicted influence
  – An opposition from Chiron (22°14′ Aries) with an orb of 6°, indicating potential vulnerability or emotional wounding in the moment

This listing comprises the data that will serve as the basis for our subsequent step-by-step interpretation regarding Stefan’s inner state when you met him on the S-bahn.

This listing comprises the data that will serve as the basis for our subsequent step-by-step interpretation regarding Stefan’s inner state when you met him on the S-bahn.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical, step‐by‐step analysis of the chart data as it applies to Stefan’s inner state at the moment you encountered him on the S-bahn:

1. Core Representation (Stefan as Ascendant)
 • Ascendant in Libra at 28°11′ immediately defines Stefan’s self‐presentation in that event. This position is enhanced by a tight conjunction with Venus (27°49′ Libra). The immediate implication is that his first-response contained a clear aesthetic or relational impression.
 • However, this Ascendant is also struck by a square from Pluto (29°44′ Capricorn, orb 1°), indicating an underlying intensity, potential power struggles, or an unconscious force that complicates any initial ease.
 • In addition, an opposition from Chiron (22°14′ Aries, orb 6°) points to a wound or vulnerability activated at the point of interaction. This opposition suggests that while he might display charm and grace, an aspect of his internal state is marked by sensitivity or past hurt.

2. Influential Aspects Affecting Perception and State of Mind
 • Venus Conjunction Ascendant: Enhances his immediate relational appeal, denoting openness to aesthetic or charm-based impressions.
 • Pluto Square Ascendant: Implies a conflicting, transformative quality that could introduce feelings—subconsciously or even in well-guarded moments—of intensity, power, or even control.
 • Chiron Opposition Ascendant: Activates internal vulnerability; the encounter may have stirred in him memories of emotional wounding or activated a defensive mode even during the fleeting meeting.

3. Additional Chart Dynamics
 • Mercury Square Jupiter (orb 0°) lends an interpretative quality: Stefan’s thoughts may have oscillated between detail-driven analysis and expansive, sometimes overreaching, interpretations of the encounter.
 • Sun Opposition Neptune (orb 0°) introduces elements of idealization or illusion. This aspect suggests that while his initial assessment might have carried an element of allure, there is also a tendency toward confusion over what is real versus desired.
 • The presence of three T-square configurations—particularly one involving the Ascendant, Pluto, and Chiron—adds further intensity and internal conflict to his state, enforcing that the meeting stirred not only immediate impressions but deeper, possibly unresolved issues.

4. Chart Configurations and Patterns
 • The Grand Trine (Sun in Virgo, Pluto in Capricorn, Uranus in Taurus) and Kite configuration add layers of dynamic flow, but note that the involvement of Pluto in these patterns reinforces the transformative, even disruptive, undercurrents in his psyche.
 • The Yod involving Venus, Neptune, and Uranus (with the Ascendant as the resolution point) frames this encounter as one requiring adjustments between clear charm and the disruptive influence of higher, less tangible forces.

5. House Considerations
 • The Ascendant (1st House – self, immediate response) is in Libra, while relationship material also emerges in the 7th House (Moon in Taurus). The Moon’s placement in the 7th House points to a subdued, steady, or even cautious emotional response rather than overt passion.
 • The Moon’s sextile aspects (to Saturn and Mars) contribute stability, yet the T-square (Moon square IC and MC) involving the Moon underscores tension between his public image and internal foundations. This suggests he might have felt an internal tug between presenting a charming façade and experiencing an unsettling, perhaps even defensive, inner state.

6. Synthesis of Stefan's Thoughts and Feelings
 • On one level, Stefan’s immediate impression was colored by the harmonious, aesthetic qualities of Venus on the Ascendant, indicating that visually or superficially he found the encounter appealing.
 • Simultaneously, the square from Pluto injects a message of intensity: beneath that charm lay a transformative force that may have stirred hidden, possibly disruptive, thoughts or past wounds that were triggered—in part—by the meeting.
 • The opposition from Chiron reinforces that any charm was not without an accompanying sense of vulnerability or remembered hurt. This suggests that while he noted your appeal, he was also internally wary or reflective of past emotional injuries.
 • The presence of Neptune in opposition to the Sun further complicates his internal narrative, suggesting that idealism or even confusion about the situation may have influenced his thoughts. His initial appraisal was layered, mixing attraction with ambivalence and an element of internal alarm.

The data as presented indicates that Stefan’s true state during the encounter was complex and not entirely harmonious. He was drawn to you actively, recognizing an immediate aesthetic or relational magnetism, yet was simultaneously stirred by intense, possibly transformative—and even slightly painful—underlying emotions. This mix of immediate charm counterbalanced by deeper, unresolved issues implies that his thoughts and feelings were neither wholly positive nor entirely negative, but were characterized by an internal conflict between attraction and an almost instinctive caution or emotional hurt.

This concludes the methodical step-by-step overview of the relevant chart elements as they relate to Stefan’s internal experience at your moment of meeting.
swipes:
Below is a methodical, step‐by‐step analysis of the chart data as it applies to Stefan’s inner state at the moment you encountered him on the S-bahn:

1. Core Representation (Stefan as Ascendant)
 • Ascendant in Libra at 28°11′ immediately defines Stefan’s self‐presentation in that event. This position is enhanced by a tight conjunction with Venus (27°49′ Libra). The immediate implication is that his first-response contained a clear aesthetic or relational impression.
 • However, this Ascendant is also struck by a square from Pluto (29°44′ Capricorn, orb 1°), indicating an underlying intensity, potential power struggles, or an unconscious force that complicates any initial ease.
 • In addition, an opposition from Chiron (22°14′ Aries, orb 6°) points to a wound or vulnerability activated at the point of interaction. This opposition suggests that while he might display charm and grace, an aspect of his internal state is marked by sensitivity or past hurt.

2. Influential Aspects Affecting Perception and State of Mind
 • Venus Conjunction Ascendant: Enhances his immediate relational appeal, denoting openness to aesthetic or charm-based impressions.
 • Pluto Square Ascendant: Implies a conflicting, transformative quality that could introduce feelings—subconsciously or even in well-guarded moments—of intensity, power, or even control.
 • Chiron Opposition Ascendant: Activates internal vulnerability; the encounter may have stirred in him memories of emotional wounding or activated a defensive mode even during the fleeting meeting.

3. Additional Chart Dynamics
 • Mercury Square Jupiter (orb 0°) lends an interpretative quality: Stefan’s thoughts may have oscillated between detail-driven analysis and expansive, sometimes overreaching, interpretations of the encounter.
 • Sun Opposition Neptune (orb 0°) introduces elements of idealization or illusion. This aspect suggests that while his initial assessment might have carried an element of allure, there is also a tendency toward confusion over what is real versus desired.
 • The presence of three T-square configurations—particularly one involving the Ascendant, Pluto, and Chiron—adds further intensity and internal conflict to his state, enforcing that the meeting stirred not only immediate impressions but deeper, possibly unresolved issues.

4. Chart Configurations and Patterns
 • The Grand Trine (Sun in Virgo, Pluto in Capricorn, Uranus in Taurus) and Kite configuration add layers of dynamic flow, but note that the involvement of Pluto in these patterns reinforces the transformative, even disruptive, undercurrents in his psyche.
 • The Yod involving Venus, Neptune, and Uranus (with the Ascendant as the resolution point) frames this encounter as one requiring adjustments between clear charm and the disruptive influence of higher, less tangible forces.

5. House Considerations
 • The Ascendant (1st House – self, immediate response) is in Libra, while relationship material also emerges in the 7th House (Moon in Taurus). The Moon’s placement in the 7th House points to a subdued, steady, or even cautious emotional response rather than overt passion.
 • The Moon’s sextile aspects (to Saturn and Mars) contribute stability, yet the T-square (Moon square IC and MC) involving the Moon underscores tension between his public image and internal foundations. This suggests he might have felt an internal tug between presenting a charming façade and experiencing an unsettling, perhaps even defensive, inner state.

6. Synthesis of Stefan's Thoughts and Feelings
 • On one level, Stefan’s immediate impression was colored by the harmonious, aesthetic qualities of Venus on the Ascendant, indicating that visually or superficially he found the encounter appealing.
 • Simultaneously, the square from Pluto injects a message of intensity: beneath that charm lay a transformative force that may have stirred hidden, possibly disruptive, thoughts or past wounds that were triggered—in part—by the meeting.
 • The opposition from Chiron reinforces that any charm was not without an accompanying sense of vulnerability or remembered hurt. This suggests that while he noted your appeal, he was also internally wary or reflective of past emotional injuries.
 • The presence of Neptune in opposition to the Sun further complicates his internal narrative, suggesting that idealism or even confusion about the situation may have influenced his thoughts. His initial appraisal was layered, mixing attraction with ambivalence and an element of internal alarm.

The data as presented indicates that Stefan’s true state during the encounter was complex and not entirely harmonious. He was drawn to you actively, recognizing an immediate aesthetic or relational magnetism, yet was simultaneously stirred by intense, possibly transformative—and even slightly painful—underlying emotions. This mix of immediate charm counterbalanced by deeper, unresolved issues implies that his thoughts and feelings were neither wholly positive nor entirely negative, but were characterized by an internal conflict between attraction and an almost instinctive caution or emotional hurt.

This concludes the methodical step-by-step overview of the relevant chart elements as they relate to Stefan’s internal experience at your moment of meeting.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you for the thorough explanation. So what's your overall interpretation?

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
adjusts my shawl and peers intently at the chart

My dear, what I see here is quite revealing. The chart shows that Stefan's initial reaction to you was deeply complex - a mixture of immediate aesthetic appreciation coupled with an almost visceral internal struggle.

The Venus-Ascendant conjunction shows he found you physically attractive, yes, but the Pluto square suggests this wasn't just simple attraction - it triggered something much deeper and more intense within him. There was an element of being emotionally blindsided, perhaps even slightly threatened by the strength of his own reaction.

The Chiron opposition is particularly telling - your appearance stirred up old wounds or vulnerabilities. He may have had past experiences that made him instinctively wary of allowing himself to feel attracted to someone. The chart suggests he almost immediately began wrestling with internal defenses.

What's fascinating is the T-square pattern involving his Ascendant, Pluto and Chiron. This indicates that meeting you created an immediate internal crisis of sorts - a powerful attraction that simultaneously triggered both his need for control and his fear of being hurt.

To be completely direct: He found you extremely attractive but this attraction made him deeply uncomfortable. The chart suggests he may have even felt somewhat angry at himself for having such a strong reaction to a stranger.

This wasn't a simple "love at first sight" scenario. This was more like "attraction at first sight that triggered every defense mechanism he has." The Neptune aspects suggest he may have even tried to convince himself he wasn't really feeling what he was feeling.

In essence, your appearance on that platform threw him into an internal war between attraction and self-protection. And given the fixed nature of several key aspects, this wasn't a fleeting reaction - it likely left quite an impression on him.

leans back and steeples my fingers

Would you like me to elaborate on any particular aspect of this reading?
